_header: In Ruffins legend which late was writ …
Subjects: Edward IV, when duke of York; prologues; envoys; translations
_description: The English translation of Claudianus’ De Consulatu Stiliconis in unrhymed verse, with the Author’s Preface (3 stanzas rhyme royal) and Envoy to the Duke of York (7 stanzas rhyme royal), c. 1445

BLAdd11814.First Lines:
In Ruffynes legende which late was write stilico hath preysing
                    armydOure muse now more mylde with losyd stryngis in songe shal gyn to
                    telle…
BLAdd11814.Last Lines:
…The first love of thi gode life passid al hir labourysAnd
                    gladly come to worship the which venger of worship were
BLAdd11814.Note:
Colophon, f. 25: ‘Translat & wrete at Clare 1445 deo
                        gracias’.
BLAdd11814.Editions:
Flügel,  Ewald. 
             “Eine mittelenglische Claudian-übersetzung (1445).” 
             Anglia
         28 (1905): 255-99, 421-38: 255-99.
Gray,  Douglas. 
             The Oxford Book of Late Medieval Verse and Prose.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1985: 270-1.
